comments.body: You can already use sea pickles to light the ocean floor so drowned don't spawn
Hi abanmm4. In some ways, I do agree with you, but placing pickles can just be annoying after awhile.
Leather and something such as sugar or a bucket of water could make culled leather, and when you are culling the leather it could be the only time to dye it
bruh

110% agree. The current design makes no sense. Think about it. The entire hide of a cow isn’t enough to make a helmet? WTF.
Especially since armor takes damage and has to be replaced. Leather armor should be easy enough that you always have but are tasked with making. Not burdened in acquiring.
Hopefully they release new potions like this one along with the unreleased luck potion.

They could make potion for several other environments as well. A mountain climber potion would let you climb up only stone (not dirt) as long as you have sky access (so no ravine climbing).  Pretty much only mountains have crazy enough terrain to show enough stone and make this useful. A snow biome potion would prevent you from slipping on ice (you can still move faster while jumping on ice) and would increase your speed while on a snow layer. If they want these to take multiple ingredients (such as stone and granite for the mountain one) then they could use the enourmous backlog of ineffective potion types that used to exist.
I think there is a similar post about something growing in the basalt deltas.
Basalt deltas should have zero signs of life.
Not that this is a bad idea, but I think the point of the basalt deltas was it to be rocky and barren. The flower is good, but it doesn't fit in with the purpose of the biome.
I think there should be more foliage in the nether
How did you put an image ???!!!!!

Soul fire charge?

yes.

magma and lava? I dunno...

This is a great idea.

What if you could use the soul lava with blue ice to make a blackstone generator? That'd be cool.

Soul magma! Yes! Ultimate yes! Generates instead of normal magma in soul sand valleys. Soul fire charge! Sure. Soul lava! Yes! Generates if lava is in the soul sand biome and if a lava source block is touching soul soil. Maybe it can be collected and kept blue with a netherite bucket.

edit (spelling)
if this is java I am only on PE and Xbox 360

Maybe soul lava could be created when it is sitting directly above soul sand, soul soil, soul magma block, or another block of soul lava. Soul fire charges could be shot by soul Ghasts, and on compact, it creates soul sand, soil, and/or fire around it.
Yes! This it the best post on soul fire variants I have seen so far and the only thing I was looking for was soul fire charges, I didn't even think about OTHER variants.

Eso sería bueno para evitar que otros jugadores entren a tu casa mientras no estás o no quieres, pero no me gusta que sea del nether, mejor sería una puerta de hierro con una modificación, y si no, una puerta que solo se abre si alguien tiene su respectiva llave
What about if someone was following right behind you?
Si para resguardar los materiales importantes o para mejor seguridad.
some one could use you skin tho
Possible crafting recipe: iron door + single netherite ingot.
I like the door idea, but the is scanner doesn’t fit with Minecraft’s main themes, Olsen times and magic
I think Netherite doors only open by max redstone power
Kinda just stealing from Terraria.
Maybe a little more than just one item to smelt though. Hoping on a few ores they add, in which case it can smelt a few new ores, perhaps that a blast furnace can not. Useful, but perhaps limited.

Dude I had exactly the same idea! And the nether forge could be found in the fortress and also be used to smelt nether gold ore, cause if you are doing nether only currently there is no way to smelt it. I absolutely agree and would love to see this added!

Such a cool detail. 

I feel like this would be a great mechanic! Adds a lot more dilemma. If they were to do this though, I feel like something similar should happen with Brewing stands. Like maybe Brewing stands could blow up and poison the player for a period of time? The harder it is to get, the worse it gets impacted by doing something wrong. Like a Blast furnace should not only blow up, but set fire to your house. That way having these things has a consequence if you don't use it right. 

If I'm honest, Minecraft can be quite eventless when mini dilemmas don't exist. Little details like this need to be added in my opinion. Doing so would make countless stories. 

For example a furnace could blow up and open up a wall at night letting in a hoard of mobs. It's far more eventful and gives Minecraft a lot more depth with just simple mechanics like this.

I don't see a point, it would add needless frustration, and stone exists right next to lava tools. Further more that makes no sense physically. The item itself would need to generate the heat, which would also mean that it would burn the player. If nether items exploded in the furnace, so would regular iron and gold. This exploding furnace would be more at home in the nether.
Two potential ways of crafting gold arrows are a) similarly to firework stars, base materials and "add-ons" being placed in a crafting grid, or b) utilizing the Fletching Table with a unique GUI
Good idea, but I think this needs more uses if it's going to be added to the game. In my opinion, it's too similar too a regular crossbow.
I agree with this idea, But I think that crossbow bolts should also do more damage.

I really like the idea of the bolts themselfes, they would give a great use to the fletching table and could fix the issue with scoped crossbow that i would have, with the normal arrows not traveling far enough. Bit since i would really desire a scoped crossbow i think this would be exactly the right idea. I think the bolts should behave like normal arrows but do more damage and travel further and with wayy less drop but overall i think the damage should never overtake a Power V bow. In Addition to that i think the bolts should be rather expensive to balance things like maybe a cristal as tip one iron ingot in the middle and a feather for one bolt. An then use the fletching table for different upgrade ideas to achieve the better characteristics like straighter flight and more damage.

To further differentiate the steel crossbow from the normal one, I suggest special bolts:

Blaze Bolt- (Blaze rod+fire charge) an explosive projectile (same size of TNT)

Breeze Bolt- (wind charge + feather + breeze rod?) 6 hearts on direct hit, way higher knock back, but if you miss, the bolt can be picked up again (chance to disappear). (Could work w/loyalty)

Copper bolts- (Lightning rod+feather+ copper ingot) Activates redstone when hitting redstone-related blocks. When in thunderstorm, copper bolts can summon lightning.
Will these vines drop when the source is broken by hand or piston, or only by shears? How will the vines know how their source was destroyed? Just some things to think about :)
DIAMONDS!!!! are a great idea to be in the nether
or maybe nether diamonds that are yellow
no cave update coming
It could maybe spawn rarely and near lava

I actually just made a post about this, but it should only spawn in the Soul Valleys, where everything is Blue. I have some other cool ideas on there too. Septic tanks for water in the nether, and Gold Guilded Netherite Armor for protection from falling, damage, AND not being attacked on sight by the Piglins.
Diamonds in the soul sand  valley yes.
Cool now this sounds like a good idea but one question how do you get the honey? We have no Honey Bees in the game.
4 food point
Yeah, add with berry bread
yep, i think the elder gurdian should also drop a heart of the sea, nakes sense right.

I think a nautilus shell would be better. You can find a heart of the sea pretty easily with a treasure map, but in order to get eight nautilus shells you're forced to grind-fish or go hunting for Drowned in hopes of finding one with a shell.

I think this is great. Ocean Monuments have been around since 1.8, but haven't changed in all that time. No one goes to Monuments except for a handful of things: sponges, mining fatigue for 'How Did We Get Here', prismarine. If there was some loot, like tridents and nautilus shells, that would make the monuments a lot better.
Do You find it in the nether?
Seems kinda unnessecary to make this a new weapon. Simply being able to apply fire aspect to a trident would probably be better.
Yes, most likely it would be found in the nether, possibly accompanied by a new mob which would be cool
I think it would be cool if this was dropped but a new mob found in a new structure, kind of like how drowneds have there own structure.
The new mob could be an alter ego of the drowned mob. It lives in the lave but comes out to attack you.
I agree with FwootSaled, enchanting a trident with Fire Aspect is a better solution.
Devil Trident? Wouldn't it be called pitchfork...     oh a if it comes with a new mob it would be a red or darkish blue demon
Amethyst’s would be a good rare item true, but it should be the rarest. i’m Really hoping for amethysts
Sounds like an awesome idea!
I feel like this would be too cheap for infinite duration
This sounds like mods . Amethyst in the end and tools and armor make more sense.
Maybe it could be used in an enchantment table instead of lapis lazuli to receive better enchantments?

ADD WANDS ✨💥🚫🚫🚫
You have to allow the crystals to also be used in a new crafting table for wands. Allow us to enchant them with specific spell books and cast spells and we can use certain materials as wand cores.

Imagine an enchanted amethyst crystal or gem ina
A wood type stick thats coated in a special metal or stone like powder similar to redstone or lapiz.
This is nice, since gems are being added in the next update. Maybe jewelry can be found as rare loot too in archeology sites.

This would be a great use for copper too. Gemstones (amethyst, diamond, emerald, lapis) set in copper housings that can be enchanted for a lower cost than armor. They should take up the same armor slots so their is a trade off to have higher defense or enchantments. Basically more protection from the environment, or more protection from mobs.
I never noticed that.
Totally agree, wish this was the case with crafting tables and things too. It really bugs me that I can't use the vertical planks side won all walls.

I totally agree, I found myself earlier trying to make a really cool wall using them but then I realized, they can't be rotated. I feel that if Mojang were to add something little like making the tables rotatable it could open up quite a few possibilities for building.
That's basically another version of a cow.

A bison would be cool, maybe if they dropped their horns, or if their bones could be made into bone bowls or the marrow eatable. Maybe the become hostile if attacked and have their herd attack like pigmen. For now, it would probably just be a bigger cow.

I would love the idea of of a bison.

I think that you should be able to tame them and there should be like a bison leader thing that if you tame the whole herd becomes tamed. They should be tamed by wheat. They should also have a saddle and maybe armor. It would be like a horse but a bit slower and could attack hostile mobs.

I hope this gets added soon.

I love the idea of adding more American animals to Minecraft like the Axolotl!
One problem is that Mojang will probably refuse to give resources for hunting them; but to me that seems unfair because people have been killing and respecting bison since before the American megafauna died.
ok, I think u might be on to something. voted
Maybe a good crafting recipe would be a piece of Redstone surrounded by 4 Lapis Lazuli?

I like this idea and it will go good with the Caves and Cliffs update but instead of the item showing you your Y axis coordinates, it will just tell you just by hovering or scrolling on the item itself.

with ore distribution being different at different world heights, knowing your y-level is more important than ever. I might be wrong but bedrock doesn't even have the debug menu which just seems a bit unintuitive

i think you should craft this with copper to give copper an extra use, checking the coordinates is quite confusing especially for newer players, so a depth meter would be pretty useful and by making it craftable with copper, it gives copper more use. Voted
I particularly like the idea of sticking weapons, sticks and blaze rods in the ground.
Ice cream cone could be crafted with one snowball, one sugar, and one bread. When eaten, it gives you a freeze buff so you are immune to magma, fire, and lava damage.
I think he forgot the wooden bowl to place the Ice cream but I am all for the idea
now that the cave update added powder snow i think it could be an awesome addition to the game, crafted with powder snow, milk, cocoa seeds and a bowl

How about new features to place milk in a cauldron, put the dripstone thing above it, place powder snow above the stalagcffcfffite- whatever it's called, and then soon enough it will turn into ice cream which can be collected with a bowl and be cocoa beans xould be added or some crops.

If vanilla beans were added, those could be used instead of cocoa beans or sweet berries to make vanilla ice cream. If vanilla beans don't get added though, then just using cocoa beans or sweet berries would be fine. I just think it would be cool to have three different flavors instead of just two!

With the implementation of powdered snow, you could add a use regarding ice cream as we assume that minecraft is set in the medieval era and at that time there was no machine that we have to make ice cream as today, but I think with the powdered snow (in its bucket version) with blackberries (as an ingredient) with paper (like cone) and sugar , it could be crafted and if you eat many in a certain time (about 5 minutes) it will give you partially freezing, but when you eat one will give you speed for 5 seconds, leave me if you like the implementation of the ice cream

Ice cream probably wouldn't restore much hunger or saturation, but a great use for ice cream could be to immediately extinguish yourself if you're on fire, a life saver in the Nether if you don't have fire protection or fire resistance
It actually would be a huge deal. This is too overpowered, since in Bedrock Edition you can right-click on a spawner with an egg to change it to a spawner of that mob. Not a good idea, sorry :(
No.  Spawn eggs are only meant for creative.
it would be very rare. like the percentage of getting five diamonds in one desert temples.
That is very overpowered. Can't vote for it.
It would break the game... People would really exploit this.

Chicken spawn eggs (red and white chicken spawn egg) produces in chests by using a hopper and a mob spawner in surival mode and when you kill the chickens it produces a red and white spawn chicken egg!
I actually agree with this idea I mean we already have mob farms, so saying this is op would be like denying we weren't making mob farms already which was never intended lol.
No, you shouldn't. Motorcycles do not fit Minecraft at all. Seriously, what are you thinking??
You can't just add motorcycles.  You would have to add so many more things in order to get the motorcycle.  Like oil, gas, materials, etc.
Motorcycles are a good MOD Idea, but they don't fit in vanilla Minecraft. Minecraft is set in a time WAY before motorcycles, and it won't make sense to implement them to the game
Maybe old timey bicycles will work but still... No.
I love this idea for Minecraft. It will help players get around faster but may not fit the game but some sort of transportation to drive in like a wagon powered by horse
You can already have higher transportation in Minecraft. They're called Elytras.
Yassssss!
Neat idea! This could be helpful for Nether Explorers who dislike the bright orange sky that is seen after consuming a Night Vision potion there.

I would make it a little better than the image shows.  Definitely not as good as night vision, but actually reasonable to be able to see something.  I know I would use this enchantment, especially since I play with a screen as dark as it goes to prevent bright areas from being too bright.
This is a neat idea.  It would be like the Optifine feature of a held torch giving off light, but implemented in a different way.
Maybe instead a way to attach a lantern to your helmet
This sort of enchantment should also be available for shields.
Its texture could be a black version of the quartz pluck with all the same variants. Somewhat like how the sandstone and red sand stone blocks have similar variants.
I would just call it the Flint Block, but yes, this needs to be in the game.
Yes to all of this and they should have the same flammable property as netherrack. They should hold a fire indefinitely unless manually removed.
I think a flintstone block could be a cool feature. Combining flint into a block could save storage space in your inventory and chests, as well as a decoration block.
Nice
leather blocks will still have a texutre so it won't be concrete
I was just thinking this
I would be cool if they cycled through drawn designs like those on teepees, like paintings, instead of being dyeable.
